coding_practice.title: Longest Uncommon Subsequence I
coding_practice.description:
Given two strings a and b, return the length of the longest uncommon subsequence between a and b. If no such uncommon subsequence exists, return -1.

An uncommon subsequence between two strings is a string that is a subsequence of exactly one of them.

examples.explanation: One longest uncommon subsequence is "aba" because "aba" is a subsequence of "aba" but not "cdc". Note that "cdc" is also a longest uncommon subsequence.
The longest uncommon subsequences are "aaa" and "bbb".
Every subsequence of string a is also a subsequence of string b. Similarly, every subsequence of string b is also a subsequence of string a. So the answer would be -1.

coding_practice.constraints:
1 <= a.length, b.length <= 100
a and b consist of lower-case English letters.
coding_practice.explanation:
1. 若 a 與 b 完全相同，則不存在不相同的子序列，返回 -1。
2. 若 a 與 b 不同，則較長的字串本身就是不相同的子序列，直接返回 max(len(a), len(b))。
